thread.title: Five-year-old Blue Ivy Carter sort of stole the Grammys
thread.title_full: Five-year-old Blue Ivy Carter sort of stole the Grammys

author: USA TODAY
title: Five-year-old Blue Ivy Carter sort of stole the Grammys
text:
Five-year-old Blue Ivy Carter sort of stole the Grammys Andrea Mandell , USA TODAY Published 11:06 p.m. ET Feb. 12, 2017 | Updated 2 minutes ago 
This was hardly Blue Ivy Carter's first awards show , but at the Grammys Sunday night, the cherubic 5-year-old basically stole the night. 
Blue Ivy for the win. (Photo: Christopher Polk, Getty Images for NARAS) 
Was it her Prince-inspired pink Gucci suit? Her sparkly kid-size cat purse? The moment cameras caught Jay Z giving his daughter (a soon-to-be-big sister ) a sweet kiss on the cheek? Or how she jammed to Bruno Mars and ecstatically cheered on her mom when she won best urban contemporary album for Lemonade ? Blue Ivy was pumped for her mom #GRAMMYs pic.twitter.com/xh0olZR8sP — The Daily Beast (@thedailybeast) February 13, 2017 
Blue had a cameo in Beyonce's visual introduction to her performance of Love Drought and Sandcastles . TINA, BEYONCÉ ET BLUE IVY! WOW #GRAMMYS pic.twitter.com/huxYCWnpvr — Beyoncé Brasil (@beyoncebrasil) February 13, 2017 
And let's not forget about Blue Ivy crashing (saving?) James Cordon's Grammys Carpool Karaoke. 
Cat purse! (Photo: Christopher Polk, Getty Images for NARAS) 
If Bey and Jay's twins are anything like big sis Blue, we're in for a cuteness overload. Facebook   Chance the Rapper makes it 3-for-3 by winning best rap album for Coloring Book during the 59th Annual Grammy Awards. Robert Hanashiro, USA TODAY NETWORK Taraji P. Henson presents the Best Rap Album award to Chance The Rapper. Robert Hanashiro, USA TODAY NETWORK James Corden introduces the George Michael tribute performed by Adele. Robert Hanashiro, USA TODAY NETWORK After a snafu, Adele stops the performance and starts again to get it right: "I'm sorry, I can't mess this up for him." Robert Hanashiro, USA TODAY NETWORK The Grammys pay tribute to the late George Michael with Adele doing a new, slowed-down orchestral arrangement of his song Fastlove. Robert Hanashiro, USA TODAY NETWORK Newly minted Grammy winner Maren Morris (R) joins Alicia Keys on a performance of the country singer's Once. Robert Hanashiro, USA TODAY NETWORK William Bell (L) and Gary Clark Jr. present Beyonce with the Grammy for Best Urban Contemporary Album. Robert Hanashiro, USA TODAY NETWORK Beyonce accepts the Grammy for Best Urban Contemporary Album. Robert Hanashiro, USA TODAY NETWORK William Bell (L) and Gary Clark Jr. perform a cover of Albert King's Born Under a Bad Sign. Robert Hanashiro, USA TODAY NETWORK Katy Perry performs her new single Chained to the Rhythm Robert Hanashiro, USA TODAY NETWORK Katy Perry performs during the 59th Annual Grammy Awards. Robert Hanashiro, USA TODAY NETWORK Bob Marley's grandson Skip Marley joins Katy Perry for her Grammy performance. Robert Hanashiro, USA TODAY NETWORK Feb 12, 2017; Los Angeles, CA, USA; Little Big Town performs during the 59th Annual Grammy Awards at Staples Center. Mandatory Credit: Robert Hanashiro-Little Big Town does an a cappella version of Teenage Dream to present Katy Perry. Robert Hanashiro, USA TODAY NETWORK Thomas Rhett and Camila Cabello present the award for best Country Solo Performance. Robert Hanashiro, USA TODAY NETWORK Maren Morris accepts the Grammy for Best Country Solo Performance. Robert Hanashiro, USA TODAY NETWORK Bruno Mars performs That's What I Like Robert Hanashiro, USA TODAY NETWORK Beyonce looks shimmering and regal for her medley of Love Drought and Sandcastles, which also seems to be a tribute to maternity. Robert Hanashiro, USA TODAY NETWORK Beyonce performs during the 59th Annual Grammy Awards. Robert Hanashiro, USA TODAY NETWORK Beyonce reaches back during her performance. Robert Hanashiro, USA TODAY NETWORK
